page.title: 03Local History-3 PRIZES
page.content: 1This year at the end of term Prize-giving Service at our School the Dean of Guild of Perth Guildry Incorporation came all dressed up in his ceremonial robes and chain of office. His cloak is scarlet with ermine trimmings and his chain is solid gold. Mr. Menzies is the Dean this year. Our other guest was a lady from the RNLI who came to receive the sum of Â£203 which twelve of us had raised at a Fun Run in Perth. The Guildry give us prizes when they visit in June every year and we thought it would be a good idea for us to be giving something to somebody else on the day that the Dean came to award the Guildry prizes for "Good Citizenship".
